title: Assassins are too rewarding for how easy they are to play
body:
Most of them have access to stealth, a repositioning ability, or both. Most of them don't have skillshots, and if they do it's an ability with an extremely large hitbox (Kha'zix 'w'). And of course they have some of the best single target nukes in the game. And a lot of them also have resets on their jumps/dashes/etc, which makes it extremely hard to punish them after they murder your team. Oh, and I forgot, most of them also have access to abilities that heal them (Rengar, Kha'zix, Akali, Master Yi, etc). The amount of survivability assassins have in their kits is absolutely insane. And let's not forget about the massive buffs armor pen items got this year. TLDR assassins are way too easy to play and the class as a whole needs some serious gutting.

Oh, and I forgot. Most of them are also manaless. And most of their ults have extremely short cooldowns. And Riot makes it even easier for them to itemize cdr, since more armor pen items also have cdr.

Ok, since you're such an expert, please tell me what is the "traditional classification"?

Note that really really old champs, prototypes for something and a few others are, in a way exceptions or appear to be so but really aren't once you actually think about it. For the most part this refers to {{champion:39}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:238}} 

Assassins are champs that typically are designed for single target burst with frontloaded damage and abilities meant to remove the ability to retaliate quite enough in time. They also tend to have EXTREMELY strong engaging abilities when looked at in a vacuum. Rather than strong defenses they are typically either rewarded heavily for killing the opponent or just evade damage altogether. 

Assassins are not heavy survivability champs and will be punished somewhat for trying to be. They are cousins of the carry and will typically share some traits with them. 

Carries on the otherhand are just heavy damage dealers that tend to deal a lot of sustained damage over time. One of the biggest differences between a carry and assassin is the front loaded damage and the reliability of their engage pattern. Melee carries tend to resemble assassins but rather than literal evasion they tend to have some ridiculous "lol nope" ability.

In otherwords

{{champion:107}}  - problematic fighter with an offcolor ult like {{champion:59}} {{champion:254}} 
{{champion:11}}  - melee adc aka melee carry aka carry type assassin aka not really an assassin but can sortof do their job
